website_summaries.verdict: Popular among business professionals. This calculator is ideal for those in finance, accounting and economics.
pros: Operates in two modes: performs common math tasks in standard calculator mode, and financial calculations, such as cash flow analysis and list-based statistics in worksheet  mode
cons: Some users find the buttons under-responsive, which can be frustrating in fast-paced environments

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality buttons
customer_reviews.text: I like the functions of this calculator, however the buttons are poorly made and when typing the numbers in quickly you can make a lot of errors. For some reason the buttons don't always accept and you are left with missing numbers and wrong answers. I have to be very careful or redo the problem which wastes time. I wish my TI-83 had the financial functionality of the calculator because I like the buttons better.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for MBA Candidates, but mediocre for advanced finance work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator for Finance/Business Majors and MBA candidates. It is sufficient for the majority of coursework an accounting/finance major would be taking, and it's allowed on the CFA exam. Better yet, it doesn't require RPN (Reverse Polish Notation... yes, that's what it's actually called) which is unintuitive like many HP options use. The one caveat: If you're concentrating in finance and taking course work focused on fixed income or derivatives, you may prefer a scientific calculator like the ti30/ti34 or a graphing calculator. These courses can involve some simple but very tedious algebra so calculators with variables and multi-line displays can be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Since the Amazon seller turned out to be a fraud and I had to get a refund, I wound up buying this product from a local Target store. It is truly excellent. I had used a much more expensive Sharp financial calculator for many years prior to replacing it and this one is much better. Easier to use, more solidly built, the whole works. This is an excellent financial calculator. You can use it for ordinary adding, subtracting, dividing and multiplying but you can also use it for more complicated things like figuring out payments on mortgages and other loans at various interest rates and with various repayment times.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: What good is a calculator if the keypad doesn't work properly??
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight calculator with a springy, wobbly keypad. The keys register about 2/3 of numbers I press. To avoid a mistake, I need to watch the screen carefully to make sure that each number I press shows on the screen. This is just NOT acceptable. This calculator can not even perform one of its most basic functions -- register a number when you press the key. The dollar store calculators are more confidence-inspiring than this one. I gave up on this model and purchased the Pro version which is infinitely better and can actually perform its basic functions.
customer_reviews.author: Charles NC

customer_reviews.title: I hate this calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is the standard for financial calculators. I absolutely hate using it and I use a TI scientific calculator for most of my non-finance work. You have to reset it several times to clear things. Also, the button placement is unpleasant. But it does what it needs to. I use this for finance class and everyone has this calculator. Several people have had major issues requiring a hard reset with a pin in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive Keys and Hard to Read Screen
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is almost impossible to read in any lighting other than very bright. When I'm working on school in the evening under dim lighting with a sleeping baby, I cannot see the numbers on the screen at all. After 8 months of use, several keys are already not responding the first time. I will have to purchase a replacement soon, unfortunately it will be the same calculator as this is the recommended calculator by my school and all calculator tutorials provided by instructors are for this calculator. I will not repurchase for personal use after graduating.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear2020

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator
customer_reviews.text: i got this calculator for our friends daughter.. i had a chance to use it for a little bit and according to her its great... when i used it i love the buttons it was very easy to use and when you press on them they don't feel to close to rest of the buttons.. the color in the middle section being different color makes it easy for you to read and press. which is also great.. the calculator its self is very fast and responsive..it is not the best calculator out there but for what we paid and what it does its just great calculator..
customer_reviews.author: Esra, Burak and BABY melissa's reviews

customer_reviews.title: WHY IS IT SO HARD TO TAKE OFF THE COVER
customer_reviews.text: I thought the cover wasn't supposed to come off because it was stuck to the calculator. I tried so hard to take it off and almost broke the calculator attempting to take it off. It's become a daily exercise trying to take the cover off when I need to use it. I had to look up a video on youtube to see if the cover was removable. I own two other TI calculators and none of them have this type of crappy cover. I'm never putting the cover back on because I know it won't come off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Several of the buttons only register when pressed maybe 30% of the time (especially the zero). So I have to be extra vigilant to ensure information is correctly entered. A friend has one of these that they've used since 2017 (is when they said they got theirs) and it works perfectly. Maybe mine is a defect, but I worry the quality has gone downhill, as the friend claimed several of the "professional" versions they've used have the same issue mine does. I didn't plan on having fun during the FM, but now this is just another tiny nightmare to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse calculator
customer_reviews.text: Ahh my BAII+. One of the greater inventions by mankind. It definitely makes compounding interest, present values and future values of annuities and other payments much easier. I had a great teacher to show me the ropes of how to use such a magnificent tool so I’m unsure of how easy it is to learn on your own. However, it’s definitely a great tool for anyone who wants to be an actuary or someone that works a lot with financial math.
customer_reviews.author: David Stolz

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this calculator for my Corporate Finance college course and it works awesome! It is a little different than using some of Texas Instruments other calculators (for example to use the N, I, FV, PV, and PMT buttons you press the number you want first, and then you press that key to enter it). Other than the learning curve, this product is really great for both beginners and experienced users and is extremely affordable as well. I would buy this product again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It's cheaply made. I have the to-30xs by Texas instruments but this ba II plus is trash. The screen has weird black marks ink. I cant contact the seller. Don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: sinajda

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This calculator has been working just fine for me. I bought it because it's required for my upcoming semester of accounting classes. It was a little hard at first for me to get the hang of it as I'm used to the TI-83 Plus graphing calculator (I looked up a tutorial online to run through some practice problems - maybe spent 10 or 15 minutes until I felt comfortable with the buttons), but I'm starting to enjoy this new one. There's a lot it can do, and it's for sure going to help me on homework and tests.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Crazy settings made me crazy
customer_reviews.text: Calculator came with a CF setting of 12 which really messed me up. I’m in a finance class learning completely new things. I went over the same problems over and over again without knowing why I was getting the wrong answer. After much googling, I learned there was a value of 12 for CF instead of 1. This set me back at least an hour and a half. I tried to reset it when I was first having issues, but that did not work. I wish I had just spend the extra money for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea96

customer_reviews.title: wouldnt have been hard to make this better
customer_reviews.text: The display is okay but could be better. The decimal point and comma are too small and the last digit on the right side is too close to the side so if "1" is the last number in the display - you cant see it well. it's a bug you can get used to but definitely a design flaw. Otherwise I like the functionality - but that last digit... I dont like it and TI should have corrected it before they put it on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana John

customer_reviews.title: It is a calculator
customer_reviews.text: I am giving the low stars because a) I'm not mathematically inclined and had to have this for a business finance class and have NO clue what most of the functions are. b) It is not easy to use. See above. c) I'm old, nothing is easy to read, even with my glasses this one is difficult to read the functions. It is well made, works, and hopefully soon I'll learn how to use it. Overall, I'm sure it is a 5 star business finance calculator.
customer_reviews.author: LAWNC

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced because it is a requirement for financial testing.
customer_reviews.text: There is no reason this calculator should cost as much as it does. The only reason I think this costs so much is because it is a requirement for any testing involving finance. The buttons are very soft, and it is very easy to miss a button press. Usually this forces you to enter your data all over again. Finding instructions for this was difficult, the examples given with the package are not adequate for the work I need to do. I have watched many youtube videos to try and figure the correct and best way to solve certain problems.
customer_reviews.author: JDT

customer_reviews.title: Not at all user friendly, less than responsive buttons
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this calculator. It is not at all intuitive to use and the buttons do not always register punches; as I've used it, I've noticed that I have to be exceptionally careful to make sure each button pushed registers an expected response. Did I mention that it is not user-friendly? I feel as though I need a Ph.D. to use this thing. I never knew a calculator could elicit such a visceral response, but each time I use it, I want to punch it violently.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Foldenauer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my Finance 300 class!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator does exactly as I expected it to do. I'm taking finance 300 and needed a good Financial calculator for the class, that was inexpensive yet met my needs. This one fits the bill, plus it was recommended by my Professor. I love the PV/FV functionality, but dislike the fact that you can not do complex calculations (such as I do on my TI-84). But for the price and what the calculator is being utilized for it works well. So if you're taking a finance class at the university or community college, this calculator is a good fit and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Mislang

customer_reviews.title: Works how it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Calculates accurately any quickly. TVM function is straightfoward. The buttons kind of suck, I have to press them pretty hard to get input to register. Also have to adjust the annual return rate the first time you turn it on, otherwise it lump sums per month instead of per year. Easy to fix though, and it's outlined in the included instructions.
customer_reviews.author: CJ E.

customer_reviews.title: An affordable and effective business calculator, but no owners manual for directions
customer_reviews.text: An excellent business calculator. It does not come with instructions or an owners manual, so unless you are already extremely familiar with business math applications, you’ll be hard pressed to know how to operate it effectively. However, as a business calculator, it is a good one. The difference between the BA 2 Plus and the “Pro” models is that to change batteries, you don’t need a small screw driver for the “Pro.” Otherwise they are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult and confusing even when using the manual
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator to get through a finance class I was taking it at University. This calculator was recommended to me by the teacher of the finance class, and I could see how someone who is studying Finance or even understood it for that matter would find this calculator useful on a regular basis however for someone like me who is not interested in finance, this calculator was frustrating to use and I ended up just using my TI-84. This calculator was professionally package when it arrived shipped quickly and was undamaged. Overall the transaction was great and I'm sure the calculator is also useful just confusing and convoluted
customer_reviews.author: JDubb

customer_reviews.title: There is something wrong with this thing. I got ...
customer_reviews.text: There is something wrong with this thing. I got this for my daughter to use in a finance class she is taking to finish her degree. Even when she inputs the numbers alongside her instructor it gives a totally different answer from the instructors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trying to Learn
customer_reviews.text: Like all financial calculators, it's a little difficult to learn how to use it. But there are videos on YouTube and a manual...but I find it's easier watching the videos and then 'writing' my own manual. Don't get frustrated when you get this calculator and can't figure it out. Nobody can! You just have to learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Snickers99

customer_reviews.title: After one week of light use button faded out completely!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this calculator. Calculations were fine as long as you press the buttons down completely. The quality felt like a dollar store calculator. I have other Texas Instrument calculators and I never expected this kind of bad quality. I have never seen this brand of calculators buttons fade out completely. There are some that I have had for many years. The buttons also stick and you have to press them more than once. I had to redo several calculations. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lori A

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use for my finance class. Worked perfectly fine for about a month but now half the commands are frozen, including Clear TVM, FV, PV, PMT, the down arrow, and IRR rendering it completely useless. Price is a decent savings, I just had to purchase another for my school store for $42 so paid almost double for a replacement. Don’t know if it got battered in my bag or it was bad quality
customer_reviews.author: vbl

customer_reviews.title: Good business classes and math calculator.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a calculator for my accounting class that had the time value of money functions and this one does it. Nothing too extraordinary about the calculator, however if you need a college calculator I recommend this one for sure. Esocially business majors.
customer_reviews.author: Kenolson Collin

customer_reviews.title: For Finance, use Excel instead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Finance class in the hopes it would easily be able to use present and future value formulas for my homework and final exam. No matter how many times I tried, read the directions, and watched You Tube how-to videos, the formula wouldn’t work. I don’t know if I got a lemon or if this calculator is just not very good quality. I kept it just because I’d didn’t have a handheld calculator other than my phone. It works for basic functions. If you’re using it for finance, Excel works better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sommers

customer_reviews.title: Good Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I had to have this financial calculator for q college class. A little confusing at first, but once I figured out the functions it was pretty easy to use. It came in great shape and already had batteries and everything. The only thing I don't like was that once you push a button, what you typed before disappears. So like if I typed 6x2, it would just show the 2. I like to be able to see the whole equation, it helps me keep track of what I'm doing. But overall it's a good calculator!
customer_reviews.author: C.Burns

customer_reviews.title: Button Reaction is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this calculator again. The buttons barely react to pressure. If you aren't constantly watching to make sure you put enough pressure on each button you will never get the correct answer. I have to press super hard each time, and calculate my accounting problems multiple times to ensure I am getting all the numbers in there and the correct answers. Super frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Susandt10

customer_reviews.title: This calculator feels cheap and the 0 sticks!
customer_reviews.text: The zero button sticks. I didnt realize until I got an 88 on an exam I should of gotten 100 on! The math was wrong because of a sticky 0 button! This calculator will be taken outside and beaten Office Space style when I have some free time.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great for business majors, you need it to make your testing life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Makes Time Value Money (TVM) calculations a breeze. Which if you are taking any finance class it makes it, at least on the TVM parts, an easy venture and that section of the test was over in less then 3 minutes, got 100 on that section with no errors. If you are a business major you need this calculator. I wanted to get the pro version, but found that version is banned during tests so I am glad I got this one. I just wish it came with a solar option.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney T.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET THIS
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if mine was defective but mine stopped working after a few months. It worked fine but then I stopped using it during winter break and when I took it out for my spring semester some of the numbers would not work. Only the number 1,4,9 worked which stinks. Would not buy THIS specific product again. I had a bulky scientific calculator from a while ago (same brand) that is still going strong. Just upset this product does not last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only Buy If ***Need*** It
customer_reviews.text: Bough this for a finance class. It takes time and study to use the more complex features. Apparently there is a published how to book. Honestly, it was a waste for me as I barely used it on the test. But hey, I passed the test. If you need it for an upcoming class, buy it early and learn to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney McCloy

customer_reviews.title: Ehh. It’s okay for a finance class..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this calculator as recommended by my finance professor. I have a TI 84 which I absolutely love from Texas Instuments so I thought it would be great. Unfortunately, this one seems pretty cheap. My screen ink (if that’s even what you’d call it) gets all funky. Also, I’m not sure what other financial calculators offer but you can’t see the values that have been plugged in for (n, i/y, etc.) once you move on. It can make it challenging if you get an error to know what went wrong especially if it’s just a sign error. TLDR: this is a good cheap option but if you want a good one, I’d keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Keystrokes not recorded reliably
customer_reviews.text: I like the simple layout, but the keystrokes don't always respond. Ie, let's say I'm doing 6+7*40; if I don't slam down each key there is a high likelihood that a keystroke will not register and the formula gets busted or calculated incorrectly if an operator or number isn't recorded. Results in lots of lost time
customer_reviews.author: Sandesh Shettar

customer_reviews.title: My professor recommended this calculator for my business finance class
customer_reviews.text: The keys are sticky brand new out of the package. There is such a lag that I have never experienced with another calculator, and I am a 3rd year in university. My professor recommended this calculator for my business finance class, but I do not recommend. I have tried changing the batteries out, that still does not help. I'm not sure if it's just this calculator that's faulty or what. It's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to press buttons
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful in my Finance class. Easy to press buttons, easy to understand instructions and easy to read display. I did have to change the decimal setting because it was rounding too much for my test answers but otherwise totally fine. And changing the decimals wasn't hard either. This type of calculator is very useful for Future Value, Present Value and those kind of problems (just a few buttons rather than a huge formula) but if you don't need to do Finance, you probably don't need this type of calculator.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: You have to REALLY press the buttons
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these buttons aren't the "clicky" kind, and you have to REALLY press on them to get your entries in. Otherwise, it works as advertised and even has a little insert in the lid to guide you through the more basic functions.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing calculator!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is fantastic for real estate agents. The book provided is super helpful, but the calculator itself is wonderful. It provides prompts for getting through complex calculations such as amortization. You really could not ask for a better calculator!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for finance class
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver for my finance class. I could not have done a lot of things without this. The only issue I had was that some of the buttons required pressing them hard. If you want accurate answers for any problems picky on rounding out 3 to 4 digits. Make sure to modify the calculator to display numbers to the desired digits. Example: 1000.00 vs 1000.0000
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design, keys loose writing after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for one four week class and five buttons now have no writing on them and three others are difficult to read. I cannot believe an accounting calculator isn’t designed to be used.
customer_reviews.author: tsb

customer_reviews.title: This calculator is great except it is difficult to use and the way ...
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is great except it is difficult to use and the way they set up the equations is very confusing. Takes weeks of practice to really understand how these functions work. Ended up just doing the equations the long way on my other multiline calculator as the equations require way more work than I would like. It is almost harder to do the work on the calculator than on paper and it is hard to trust that you did the right math as you could easily forget a step or forget to click a button in the vast equations and there is no way to go back or check. Otherwise it is a reliable and slim calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great JUST LIKE THE OLD ONE
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my real estate license in 1998 I was studying loans and my teacher suggested this calculator, I had had mine since then. Just the other day I went to use it and it was dead, went right online and ordered a new one. It's great for another 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Venus Louviere

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking a finance course in my MBA program so I was required to buy a financial calculator. The professor recommended either this calculator or the HP12C. I checked details for both and I preferred this one because I it has more function possibilities. I watched a few YouTube videos to learn how to use certain features. Since then I have used it for my classwork, homework, exams, and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Shreya G.

customer_reviews.title: Calculator sporadic
customer_reviews.text: I am an MBA graduate student. This calculator does not record numbers regularly. You can enter the exact same numbers over and over and receive different answers. Also, the 0, zero seldom enters when pushed creating the need to verify every single entry or take the chance that you are short a zero or two. Yes, my professors has the same trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly fine. Plastic packaging still in tact.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why this calculator got bad reviews, but my order was completely all right. The calculator I ordered was the TI BA II Plus, and that’s what came. On top of that, the calculator was still in its plastic, with no tears or scratches. It came (packaging and product) just as it would have been sold on the shelves of an office product store. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Isles2729

customer_reviews.title: Great for college students!
customer_reviews.text: A great tool for your college student to use for two finance courses and then never look at again! I couldn't believe the things this calculator could do. Breaking down cash flows, calculating present value, future value, interpreting time value of money, simplifying those pesky apr rates so you know how much you're getting screwed on a loan to send your kid to an $80,000 university for them to decide they want a liberal arts degree! Go ahead and get this for the 2 courses they'll actually use it for in between their dorm orgies and drug binges!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan V

customer_reviews.title: Needed for my MBA program
customer_reviews.text: It was the only calculator that’s supported by my university. I’m just mind blown that TI still charges as much as they do, since technology has advanced, yet this costs the same amount as it did 20 years ago. When you pick it up and it seems like the outer case feels hollow, you’ll wonder why too.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for college
customer_reviews.text: Great for business and math classes in college, but obviously not for calculus where you'll need graphing calculators like Texas Instruments. Item just as described and good price. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Aku

customer_reviews.title: One small issue.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what I need it to do. The only thing I don’t like is that the power button is located where clear button is on every other calculator. I go to clear out something and end up turning off the calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Remi

customer_reviews.title: Buttons rubbed off within 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: buttons rubbed off after about a month of studying for CFA (pretty typical study level I'd assume not as if I was not still working full time and studying every hour). Calculator is intuitive and as predicted was easier to learn than the alternative CFA calculator. Buttons are easier to press as far as speed and response than the pro version. However, they rubbed off so quick I got the pro on the second round cause a second regular would presumably have not lasted either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I have used (and own) many of the available financial calculators on the market. I "recommend" the HP-10B to my university finance students, both graduate and undergraduate. The HP 10B is a directly positioned competitor to the TI-BA-II+, but HP's entry is superior. The keys feel more solid, the machine itself "seems" better made. Having worn out more than one of each, my experience has been that the HP has more staying power. And, the TI-BA-II+ often requires more keystrokes to accomplish the same tasks (i.e., NPV calculations). Oddly enough, when there is a difference in price, the HP often sells for around $1 less; though I would gladly pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Yunfeng Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with electrical problems
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really know why or how but my calculator arrived and right out the box 📦 it’s been having electrical / power issues. I used it during my exam and it seemed to stop working twice even though I was using it continuously
customer_reviews.author: Savannah.x02

customer_reviews.title: A little odd, but it saves a lot of time!
customer_reviews.text: The input doesn't keep up when you're typing quickly, so you have to input numbers rather paced in order to ensure accuracy. Also, I dislike that the calculator doesn't indicate small things like the input of parentheses. It seems to perform order of operations a bit oddly at times. Other than these problems, the calculator is very versatile and useful. I am using it for finance/stats classes in college and find it to be extremely time-saving and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Used for College
customer_reviews.text: I needed this calculator in several of my accounting classes. I like it. It's easy to use, and if you need help, just google what you are wanting it to do and it'll show you the steps to make that happen.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Great financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact calculator required by many college business and financial course’s. It does take time to learn how to use it correctly and you may need to watch the videos. This is for advanced applications and used in amortization and and advanced algebra and trigonometry
customer_reviews.author: Rob Barbour

customer_reviews.title: INSTRUCTIONS NOT CLEAR; I AM NOW FRUSTRATED
customer_reviews.text: This was horribly hard to figure out. The instructions were in an EXTREMELY TINY font, and they didn't make much sense anyway. I ended up using my graphing calculators FINC functions and passed my classes easily. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great and poweful tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my FRM exams. It's a powerful tool that can make your life easier. I had to learn how to use it but didn't have issues with that. Great for financial purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Karol

customer_reviews.title: Missing input at times
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I have trouble with the input, the number button doesn't seem to be responsible at times. for example if im inputting 123456, number 4 may not show up and it messed up the whole answer. so I learned to watch carefully about each input. However when I am in a rush sometimes I don't and occasionally ended up with the wrong answer. This could be just me or this particular one I got. Otherwise Calculator is easy to use once you learn it.
customer_reviews.author: AJOKIE

customer_reviews.title: Crucial for finance classes
customer_reviews.text: This calculator got me through one finance class and is currently getting me through another in college. The time-value feature, as well as npv and irr are huge for calulating them error-free and saving time.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: There are you tube vids to learn all the functions available on this calculator. I had to get it for school. Display is har for me to read and buttons are small but it’s in point with it’s competitors
customer_reviews.author: khugs

customer_reviews.title: and it is wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this calculator for a Finance class in college, and it is wonderful!!!!! Time Value of Money is simple as entering the info you know about, and hitting compute (CPT) and it spits out the data that you are trying to figure out. Unfortunately, the class is mostly conceptual, or else I'd be doing very well with the aid of this very calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Lawrence, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments BA II Plus Financial Calculator
product_meta.description:
Texas Instruments BA II plus Financial Calculator for business professionals and students features are that it performs common math as well as various financial functions; the Worksheet mode includes tables for amortization, bond, depreciation, and compound interest, Built-in memory for storage of previous worksheets, Can perform cash-flow analysis and advanced list-based statistics and a Slide-case included to protect screen.

AMAZON.COM
We're definitely taking this along with us the next time we shop for a house. Though it takes a little effort to master the collection of financial worksheets available on the Texas Instruments BA II Plus, you'll be glad you invested the time and money in this fine financial calculator.

The BA II Plus operates in standard calculator and worksheet modes. The standard mode lets you perform common math as well as operations involving the time value of money--that is, applications such as mortgages or annuities in which payments are equal and evenly spaced. You can also perform trigonometric functions in standard mode.

The more hard-core worksheet mode includes tables for amortization, bond, depreciation, and compound interest. If you're not familiar with such calculations, the very helpful user's manual will guide you through the process. All previous worksheet values are stored in memory, so you don't have to retype all the bond maturity or cash flow analysis figures.

The average user who wants to calculate a basic loan payment will be more comfortable working in the standard calculator mode. We were using the BA II Plus tools for calculating basic interest and payment periods within minutes. Still, it's good to know that the more advanced features are available for those who require heavy-duty financial computing.

Finance students and average users alike will find much to like in the Texas Instruments BA II Plus. --John Frederick Moore
